Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that "all real estate transactions will be subject to a 3.8% Sales Tax," when in reality, it only applies to high earners who make up less than 5 percent of all taxpayers.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that all real estate transactions will be subject to a 3.8% Sales Tax.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by assuming that the tax will apply to all real estate transactions, when in fact, it only applies to investment income of high earners.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanation bias in the provided claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the tax only applies to high earners, not all real estate transactions.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of faltering bias in the provided claim.
